member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudApplication
member.summary: Represents an application running in the cloud. For each application, you must provide an instance of CloudApplication, which the Batch Apps framework uses to map job types to processing classes and application images.
member.remarks: The framework examines the CloudApplication object only during startup. Changes made to CloudApplication properties after the framework has loaded will have no effect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudApplication.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudApplication.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application. This is used to locate the application image (virtual hard disk file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudApplication.JobTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the job types processed by this application.
member.remarks: This member supports the case where an application processes multiple job types; in the common case where the application processes only one job type, the property is more convenient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudApplication.JobType
member.summary: Gets or sets the job type processed by this application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudFileNotFoundException
member.summary: The exception that is raised when an is asked for a file that does not exist in cloud storage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudFileNotFoundException.ContainerName
member.summary: Gets the name of the cloud storage container from which the file was requested.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudFileNotFoundException.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the file that was not found in cloud storage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudNodeRole
member.summary: Specifies the role of an ; that is, the processing service provided by that node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudNodeRole.WebService
member.summary: The node runs the Cloud Fabric Web Service and job splitters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudNodeRole.ParallelProcessor
member.summary: The node runs embarrassingly parallel workloads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudNodeRole.MpiProcessor
member.summary: The node runs MPI workloads. It may be a head node or a child node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.CloudNodeRole.Unknown
member.summary: The node was not recognised as any type that runs cloud assemblies.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess
member.summary: Represents an external program.
member.remarks: This is a convenience class for task processors to run programs from the application image. You can run programs directly using the type, but ExternalProcess supports common idioms such as exit code handling, retrying, etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.Run
member.summary: Runs the external program.
member.returns: The results of the program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.CommandPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the external program path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets the arguments passed to the external program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory for the external program process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Gets the environment variables to be set on the external program process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.CancellationToken
member.summary: Gets or sets a cancellation token which can be used to cancel the external process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.ErrorPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how to handle errors (nonzero exit codes) from the external process. The default is to throw an on any nonzero exit code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.MessagePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how to handle messages (text printed to standard output or standard error) from the external process.
member.remarks: This allows an external process to be terminated early if it produces output which you know means the process cannot succeed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.StandardOutputFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file to receive the external process console output (stdout). Optional.
member.remarks: The output is also available via the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.StandardErrorFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file to receive the external process console error output (stderr). Optional.
member.remarks: The error output is also available via the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcess.Log
member.summary: Gets or sets where to log messages about external program execution, if desired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorPolicy
member.summary: A delegate specifying how the method should handle external program errors (nonzero exit codes).
member.param: Information about the external program error.
member.returns: An specifying the action to take in response to the error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessagePolicy
member.summary: A delegate specifying how the method should respond to program console output.
member.param: Information about the external program output.
member.returns: An specifying the action to take in response to the console output message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessContinueOption
member.summary: Specifies whether should continue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessContinueOption.Continue
member.summary: The program should continue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessContinueOption.Abort
member.summary: The program should be aborted. This will result in an .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessError
member.summary: Contains information about a failed external process (one that has exited with a nonzero error code).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessError.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code of the external process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessError.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets any messages output by the process to standard error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessError.RetryCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times the has tried to run the program. (The first time the process fails, RetryCount will be 1.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorHandling
member.summary: Specifies how should handle a process that has exited with an error (a nonzero exit code).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorHandling.Return
member.summary: The method should return. The exit code will be available in the property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorHandling.Throw
member.summary: The method should throw an . This can be caught by the task processor or allowed to propagate up to the framework which will handle it appropriately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorHandling.RetryAfter(System.Int32)
member.summary: The method should wait for the specified time then re-run the process.
member.param: The time in milliseconds to wait before re-running.
member.returns: An object specifying retry handling.
member.remarks: The external program is re-run using the same files and settings, so this should be used only for transient errors such as network-related errors. In addition, if the error persists even after multiple retries (see the property), you should stop retrying. This will fail the task so that the compute node can be used to process other tasks. You can manually restart the task once the network error has been corrected.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorPolicies
member.summary: Contains common error handling policies for use with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorPolicies.AlwaysThrow
member.summary: Specifies that any process error should cause an to be thrown. This is the default.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessErrorPolicies.Ignore(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Specifies that specific process error codes should be ignored and should result in a normal return to the task processor; other error codes should throw an .
member.param: Exit codes that should be ignored.
member.returns: A policy which ignores the specified exit codes but throws on all others.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException
member.summary: The exception that is raised when an external program exits with a nonzero exit code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException.CommandPath
member.summary: Gets the path to the program that failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException.Arguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the program that failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code of the program that failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException.StandardOutput
member.summary: Gets any text sent by the program to standard output.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessException.StandardError
member.summary: Gets any text sent by the program to standard error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessage
member.summary: Contains a message output by an command-line program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessage.Source
member.summary: Gets the stream to which the program output the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessage.Output
member.summary: Gets the text of the message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessageSource
member.summary: The source of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessageSource.StandardOutput
member.summary: The message was output to standard output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessageSource.StandardError
member.summary: The message was output to standard error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessagePolicies
member.summary: Contains common output message handling policies for use with .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessOutputMessagePolicies.AbortOnMessageContaining(System.String[])
member.summary: Specifies that if the specified text appears in console output then the external program should be immediately aborted.
member.param: The texts which should trigger an early abort.
member.returns: A policy which aborts the external process if any of the specified texts appear on standard output or standard error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult
member.summary: Contains the results of running an external program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code of the program.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult.StandardOutput
member.summary: Gets any text sent by the program to standard output.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult.StandardError
member.summary: Gets any text sent by the program to standard error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileContainer
member.summary: Specifies the container or a file in cloud storage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileContainer.User
member.summary: The container associated with the user who submitted a job.
member.remarks: Use this container for files uploaded by a user, as these are associated with a user rather than a specific job.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileContainer.Job
member.summary: The container associated with the current job.
member.remarks: Use this container for files output by other tasks in the current job.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileServiceExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileServiceExtensions.GetInputFile(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileService,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets a file uploaded by a user, using filename and timestamp.
member.param: The .
The name of the uploaded file to retrieve.
The timestamp of the uploaded file to retrieve.
member.returns: An containing the file content and metadata.
member.exception: The file does not exist in user storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileServiceExtensions.DownloadFile(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileService,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileContainer,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileSpecifier,System.String)
member.summary: Downloads a file from cloud storage to local storage on the compute node.
member.param: The .
The containing the file to download.
Details of the file to download.
The destination path to which to download the file.
member.exception: The file does not exist in the specified container.

member.summary: Identifies a file to be processed as part of a job.

member.summary: Gets the name of the file to be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileSpecifier.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the file to be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileSpecifier.OriginalPath
member.summary: Gets the original path of the file, from which it was uploaded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileSpecifier.Hash
member.summary: Gets a hash code identifying the file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudEnvironmentService
member.summary: A service for obtaining information about the cloud environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudEnvironmentService.GetHostNode
member.summary: Gets the on which the application is running.
member.returns: The ICloudNode on which the application is running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudEnvironmentService.GetGroupNodes
member.summary: Gets the objects representing the nodes in the instance group containing the node on which the application is running.
member.returns: The nodes in the local instance group.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudNode
member.summary: Contains information about a cloud compute node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudNode.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the kind of compute node. This identifies the type of processing that is carried on on this node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudNode.Id
member.summary: Gets the cloud platform's identifier for the node, e.g. name or GUID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ICloudNode.SmbAddress
member.summary: Gets the IP address on which the node provides SMB (Server Management Block) services such as file sharing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFile
member.summary: Represents a blob in cloud storage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFile.Content
member.summary: Gets the content of the blob.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFile.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the blob.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileService
member.summary: A service for retrieving file (blob) data from cloud storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileService.GetFile(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.FileContainer,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IFileSpecifier)
member.summary: Gets a file from user or job storage.
member.param: The from which to retrieve the file.
Details of the file to retrieve.
member.returns: An containing the file content and metadata.
member.exception: The file does not exist in the specified container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob
member.summary: Contains information about an Azure Batch job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.JobId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.JobType
member.summary: Gets the job type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.JobSettings
member.summary: Gets the job settings string provided by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the job parameters provided by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.Files
member.summary: Gets the collection of files to be processed as part of this job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.PrimaryFile
member.summary: Gets the name of the 'master' file for the job.
member.remarks: In many cases a job refers to a single file and that is the primary file. When a job works on multiple files, there is typically one 'project' or 'script' file that describes how the other files are to be processed, in which case that should be the primary file. However, the Batch Apps framework does not assign any special significance to the primary file; it is just a hint from the application client to the job splitter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob.SubmitterName
member.summary: Gets the user who submitted the job.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ILog
member.summary: Provides message and error logging facilities.
member.remarks: Typically you will not invoke methods directly but will use the more convenient extension methods in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ILog.Log(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogLevel,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogVisibility,System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Logs the specified message.
member.param: The associated with the message.
Specifies whether the message should be visible to users via Mission Control or the management API, or logged only to the cloud diagnostic store.
The exception, if any, associated with this message.
The message to be logged.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask
member.summary: Contains information about an Azure Batch task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.TaskId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the task within its parent job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.TaskIndex
member.summary: Gets a numeric index associated with the task. The significance of this is application-defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.IsMerge
member.summary: Gets whether this is the merge task for the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.RequiredFiles
member.summary: Gets the collection of files that are needed for this task to be processed.
member.remarks: The Batch Apps framework downloads these files to local storage on the compute node before invoking the task processor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the parameters specified for this task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.JobId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the task's parent job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.JobType
member.summary: Gets the job type of the task's parent job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.DequeueCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times this task has been dequeued for processing.
member.remarks: The Batch Apps framework automatically retries tasks before failing them. You can use the DequeueCount property if you want to take additional actions or adjust your processing when retrying, for example to output additional diagnostic information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask.Stage
member.summary: Gets the stage of which the task is a part.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobResult
member.summary: Specifies the result of a job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobResult.OutputFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file containing the job output.
member.remarks: The Batch Apps framework automatically uploads this file from local storage to cloud storage from where it can be retrieved using the management API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobResult.PreviewFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file containing the job preview, if any.
member.remarks: If this property is specified, the Batch Apps framework automatically uploads this file from local storage to cloud storage from where it can be retrieved using the management API.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobSplitSettings
member.summary: Provides context for job splitters when the framework invokes the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobSplitSettings.ServiceProvider
member.summary: Gets an which can be used to access framework services.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, splits a job into a set of parallelisable tasks.
member.param: The job to be split.
Contains information and services about the split request.
member.returns: A sequence of tasks to be run on compute nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.JobSplitter.Log
member.summary: Gets the for user or diagnostic logging.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogExtensions.Time(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ILog,System.String)
member.summary: Logs how long a code block took to run.
member.param: The .
A descriptive message to associate with the timing information.
member.returns: An object which when disposed logs the timing information.
member.remarks: The timing information is logged at Debug level. Debug logging is turned off by default, so to see timing information you must either turn on debug logging or use the overload which takes a LogLevel. Timing messages are not user visible.

member.param: The .
A descriptive message to associate with the timing information.

member.returns: An object which when disposed logs the timing information.
member.remarks: Timing messages are not user visible.

member.summary: The message is for debugging. By default, debug logging is turned off and messages at this level are not logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: The message is informational.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: The message is a warning. Use this level for conditions which are unexpected but do not prevent you from processing the workload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: The message is an error. Use this level for conditions which prevent you from processing the workload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogVisibility
member.summary: The visibility of a log message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogVisibility.Diagnostic
member.summary: The message is stored in the diagnostic log. It is visible to developers and administrators using cloud management tools, but not via the Batch Apps portal or API.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.LogVisibility.User
member.summary: The message can be seen by users. It will be displayed in Mission Control, and can be retrieved using the management API for display in a client application or portal. (The message is also stored in the diagnostic log.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MergeTask
member.summary: Contains objects representing common merge options.
member.remarks: You can also configure the merge task manually in the job splitter by returning a task with IsMerge set to true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MergeTask.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the job should have a default merge task; that is, merge code will run, but the framework will configure the merge task automatically. This is equivalent to not returning a merge task.
member.returns: A representing a default merge task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MergeTask.Skip
member.summary: Specifies that the job does not have a merge task; that is, merge code will not run and there will be no job output.
member.returns: A representing the absence of a merge task.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiCloudApplication
member.summary: Represents a that runs using the MPI (Message Passing Interface) framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiCloudApplication.TaskProcessorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the for this application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult
member.summary: Specifies the result of a MPI (Message Passing Interface) job.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.FromExternalProcessResult(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a based on the result of an external process using standard conventions.
member.param: The result of the external process.
The file created by the external process which should be saved as task outputs.
member.returns: A MpiJobProcessResult with Success, ProcessorOutput and OutputFile based on the external process result.
member.remarks: If you want to save preview or log files, add them manually to the AdditionalFiles collection of the returned MpiJobProcessResult.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.Success
member.summary: Gets or sets the outcome of job processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.ProcessorOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be logged as the output of the external processing program.
member.remarks: This is typically or a combination of StandardOutput and .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.OutputFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file containing the job output.
member.remarks: The Batch Apps framework automatically uploads this file from local storage to cloud storage from where it can be retrieved using the management API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.PreviewFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file containing the job preview, if any.
member.remarks: If this property is specified, the Batch Apps framework automatically uploads this file from local storage to cloud storage from where it can be retrieved using the management API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiJobProcessResult.AdditionalFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets any other files to be saved in cloud storage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiTaskProcessor
member.summary: Processes a MPI (Message Passing Interface) task.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor
member.summary: Processes an individual task within a job.
member.remarks: Do not inherit from this class directly; inherit from or instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.LocalPath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the full path to a file in the .
member.param: The name of the file.
member.returns: The full path to the file.
member.remarks: This is a convenience helper to make your code a bit more readable than using Path.Combine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.ExecutablePath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the full path to a file in the (application image virtual disk).
member.param: The relative path to the file from the virtual disk root.
member.returns: The full path to the file.
member.remarks: This is a convenience helper to make your code a bit more readable than using Path.Combine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.Log
member.summary: Gets the for user or diagnostic logging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.ExecutablesPath
member.summary: Gets the path to the application image virtual disk where it has been mounted in the compute node.
member.remarks: The ExecutablesPath property points to the root of the virtual disk. Depending on how the application image is laid out on the VHD, the executables may be in a subdirectory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessor.LocalStoragePath
member.summary: Gets the directory where the framework has downloaded the files to be processed, and from which the framework expects to upload the result files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiTaskProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiTaskProcessor.RunExternalJobProcess(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, processes the MPI task.
member.param: The job to be processed.
Contains information about the processing request.
member.returns: The result of job processing.
member.remarks: Implementations typically invoke a program from the using the helper class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiTaskProcessor.GetApplicationVersion(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob)
member.summary: Gets the version of the application image for the given job.
member.param: The job for which the application version is required.
member.returns: A version string, or null if the application is not versioned.
member.remarks: The base implementation always returns null. Override it if you need to support multiple side-by-side application images.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.MpiTaskProcessor.PercentageComplete
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the percentage of the current task that has been completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelCloudApplication
member.summary: Represents a where the workload is embarrassingly parallel and where a job splitter is used to define the parallelisable tasks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelCloudApplication.JobSplitterType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the for this application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelCloudApplication.TaskProcessorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the for this application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelTaskProcessor
member.summary: Processes an individual task within an embarrassingly parallel job.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelTaskProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelTaskProcessor.RunExternalTaskProcess(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, processes a task.
member.param: The task to be processed.
Contains information about the processing request.
member.returns: The result of task processing.
member.remarks: Implementations typically invoke a program from the using the helper class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelTaskProcessor.RunExternalMergeProcess(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, processes the merge task.
member.param: The merge task.
Contains information about the processing request.
member.returns: The job outputs resulting from the merge process.
member.remarks: Implementations typically invoke a program from the using the helper class to perform the merge.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ParallelTaskProcessor.GetApplicationVersion(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ITask)
member.summary: Gets the version of the application image for the given task.
member.param: The task for which the application version is required.
member.returns: A version string, or null if the application is not versioned.
member.remarks: The base implementation always returns null. Override it if you need to support multiple side-by-side application images.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskDependency
member.summary: Describes a dependency of one task on another.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskDependency.OnId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a representing dependency on a specific .
member.param: The task ID to depend on.
member.returns: An object representing a dependency on the task with the specified ID.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings
member.summary: Provides context for task processors when the framework invokes a task processing method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings.CancellationToken
member.summary: Gets a cancellation token which the framework will use to cancel task processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskExecutionSettings.ServiceProvider
member.summary: Gets an which can be used to access framework services.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFile
member.summary: Represents a file created by an external program which is to be saved in cloud storage as a task output.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFile.Kind
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of task output that this file contains.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFile.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file to be saved in cloud storage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFileKind
member.summary: The kind of output in a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFileKind.Output
member.summary: The file contains a primary output of the task, which will be used by the merge task to create the overall job output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFileKind.Preview
member.summary: The file contains a preview of the task output, such as a thumbnail. The file is not required for subsequent tasks, but will be made available to the job owner through the management API.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFileKind.Log
member.summary: The file contains log information about the task. The file is not required for subsequent tasks, but will be available to the job owner through the management API.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskOutputFileKind.Intermediate
member.summary: The file contains intermediate output of the external program, which is not required to complete the job but which is to be kept for other purposes. A typical use case for this is if the external program failed and you want to preserve some of its working files for diagnostic purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult
member.summary: The result of processing a single (non-merge) task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.FromExternalProcessResult(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.ExternalProcessResult,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a based on the result of an external process using standard conventions.
member.param: The result of the external process.
The files created by the external process which should be saved as task outputs.
member.returns: A TaskProcessResult with Success, ProcessorOutput and OutputFiles based on the external process result.
member.remarks: Any files named as output files are added to the OutputFiles collection with a kind of . If you want to save preview or log files, add them manually to the OutputFiles collection of the returned TaskProcessResult.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.Success
member.summary: Gets or sets the outcome of task processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.ProcessorOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be logged as the output of the external processing program.
member.remarks: This is typically or a combination of StandardOutput and .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.OutputFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of files to be saved in cloud storage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.StillProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the task is still being processed asynchronously by a resource outside the compute node.
member.remarks: This is an advanced member and should not be used by normal task processors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessResult.RequestedChargeTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time for which the task processor would like the user to be billed, for example if the task processor uses an external service which incurs usage charges.
member.remarks: This is an advanced member and should not be used by normal task processors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessSuccess
member.summary: Indicates whether task processing was successful.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessSuccess.Succeeded
member.summary: The task was processed successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessSuccess.RetryableFailure
member.summary: Task processing failed, but the task should be retried automatically. This is appropriate for transient failures such as failure to contact a licence server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessSuccess.PermanentFailure
member.summary: Task processing failed, and the task should not be retried automatically. The task may still be restarted manually. This is appropriate for errors that require intervention to correct, such as a corrupt file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskProcessSuccess.NodeFailure
member.summary: Task processing failed, and may have rendered the compute node unusable for further tasks. The task may still be restarted manually. This is appropriate for system-level error conditions such as out of memory errors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier
member.summary: Describes a task to be queued for processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.WithAllJobParameters(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob)
member.summary: Copies all job parameters to the task.
member.param: The job whose parameters are to be copied.
member.returns: The task specifier, with its Parameters collection updated with all job parameters.
member.remarks: If you have already set up parameters on the task, these will not be overwritten; only job parameters whose keys are not already present on the task will be copied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.WithJobParameters(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob,System.String[])
member.summary: Copies the specified parameters from the job to the task.
member.param: The job from which to copy parameters.
The names of the parameters to copy.
member.returns: The task specifier, with its Parameters collection updated with the specified job parameters.
member.remarks: If the parameters with these keys are already set on the task, they are overwritten with the values from the job.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.RequiringAllJobFiles(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob)
member.summary: Specifies that the task requires all job files.
member.param: The job whose files are required.
member.returns: The task specifier, with its RequiredFiles collection updated with all job files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.RequiringJobFiles(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.IJob,System.String[])
member.summary: Specifies that the task requires specific job files by name.
member.param: The job whose files are required.
The files required for the task
member.returns: The task specifier, with its RequiredFiles collection updated with the specified job files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.TaskId
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the task within its parent job.
member.remarks: Task IDs are normally populated automatically for you. If you set task IDs explicitly, they must be a continuous sequence of values starting at 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.TaskIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric index associated with the task. The significance of this is application-defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.IsMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this is the merge task for the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.RequiredFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of files that are needed for this task to be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the application-defined parameters for this task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.IgnoreMissingFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Batch Apps framework should attempt to process the task even if some of the required files are not in cloud storage. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.Stage
member.summary: Gets or sets the stage of which the task is a part.
member.remarks: Stages support jobs where later tasks cannot proceed until earlier tasks have completed -- for example, a rendering workload where a set of intermediate files must be prepared before the main render can be undertaken.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Apps.Cloud.TaskSpecifier.DependsOn
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this task depends on another task.
